page.title: 08Sawston Shopping Cont.
page.content: these people went to Cambridge even though they found it crowded,because they preferred the prices and range of shops particularly for clothing.A few went to Royston, Saffron Walden, or Newmarket. The favourite day for shopping was Friday, although Tuesdays and Thursdays, when pensions and family allowance were paid were also popular.Most people used the two main supermarkets.The Green Grocer, Chemist,Butcherand Post Office were also used frequently. 27% of the people questioned would like a bigger supermarket,22% aclothing shop;17% a fabric shop; 10% a shoe shop; 7% wanted a book shop; 4% wanted a large store (e.g. B.H.S.); 2% wanted toys; 1% wanted a fish shop and launderette; the rest had no particular ideas. Most people valued the friendly, handy, corner shop.
